Context:
This is an online-only program open to domestic students. The Computer Systems Technician (T141) program is a two-year online course with a broad and in-depth technical base, focusing on system support, network administration, and web technologies. Students have access to up-to-date networking, wireless, and security lab equipment for hands-on learning. Graduates are prepared to write several industry certification exams and can find careers as computer system technicians in various sectors, providing client and network technical support. The program requires a personal computer with specifications: minimum 16 GB RAM, 256 GB SSD Hard Drive (optimal 500+ GB), quad-core i7 2.4GHz or better processor, video card with 2GB RAM minimum/4GB RAM recommended, and a webcam. Students starting in the winter term may be required to attend classes during summer months (May to August).

Students can find career opportunities as computer system technicians in IT units throughout private and public sectors, and provide client support and network technical support in various industries. Opportunities also exist for graduates in companies that offer computer support services or specialize in the sale and installation of computer systems and networks.

Context:
The text describes a Computer Systems Technology program at a college that specializes in the sale and installation of computer systems and networks. Graduates may find employment working with business clients, providing training services and ongoing support. The curriculum prepares students to write examinations leading to industry certification in Network Administration and Support after graduation.

Transfer credits are available for further study towards an Ontario College Advanced Diploma in two additional semesters. Students who complete the program may qualify for entry into university degree programs, including credit toward the Athabasca University BSc-CIS (PD).

The program consists of four semesters. Semester 1 includes courses such as IT Essentials (COMP 1151), Mathematics for Computer Technology I (MATH 1162), and Communicating Across Contexts (COMM 2000). Semester 2 includes courses like Introduction to Networks (COMP 1176), Linux Essentials (COMP 3044), and Introduction to Programming (COMP 1250).

Semester 3 includes courses such as Network Infrastructure (COMP 3136), Identity Management Services (COMP 2064), and Linux System Administration (COMP 3066). Semester 4 includes courses like Enterprise Networking and Automation (COMP 3138), Wireless Technology Fundamentals (COMP 2102), and Windows Server Network Infrastructure (COMP 2141). Students may be required to take Introduction to College Communication (COMM 1000) before progressing to COMM 2000 based on their placement test results.

No specific year or email addresses were mentioned in the text.

Context:
Program Name: Computer Systems Technician (T141)
Prerequisite Course: COMM 1000 (Introduction to College Communication)
Note: COMM 100ge1000 does not count as a course required for graduation and will incur additional charges. More information can be found at Assessment Centre.
Program Learning Outcomes:
- Identify, analyze, develop, implement, verify and document the requirements for a computing environment
- Contribute to diagnostics, troubleshooting, documenting and monitoring of technical problems using appropriate methodologies and tools
- Implement and maintain secure computing environments
- Implement robust computing system solutions through validation testing that aligns with industry best practices
- Communicate and collaborate with team members and stakeholders to ensure effective working relationships
- Select and apply strategies for personal and professional development to enhance work performance
- Apply project management principles and tools when working on projects within a computing environment
- Adhere to ethical, legal, and regulatory requirements and/or principles in the development and management of computing solutions and systems
- Assist with the implementation of computer systems and cloud solutions
- Install, configure, troubleshoot, maintain, upgrade and decommission information systems infrastructure for a secure computer systems environment
- Automate routine tasks using scripting tools and programming languages
- Install and monitor a database management system in response to specified requirements
- Provide technical support for information system infrastructure that aligns with industry best practice
Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Tuition: $4,236.00 (for the first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2022)
Financial Assistance: Approved for OSAP funding if the applicant meets OSAP eligibility criteria.
Admission Requirements:
- Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent
- Grade 12 English (C or U)
- Grade 11
Note: Information contained in this website is subject to change without notice. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Computer Systems Technician Program (Online) T191 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context: Ario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent is required for applicants, with a grade of C or U in grade 12 English and either a grade of M or U in grade 11 math or a grade of C or U in grade 12 math. Mature students (19 years of age or older and no OSSD) can take the Admissions Assessment for English and math, or consider upgrading to achieve the credits needed in English and math. George Brown College offers the Computer Systems Technician program through its School of Computer Technology at Casa Loma Campus located at 146 Kendal Avenue. Applicants may visit the campus for an information session or campus tour, or explore the virtual tour. Contact the Computer Technology office at 416-415-5000, ext. 4287 (email: computertechnology@georgebrown.ca) or contact Maziar Masoudi, Program Co-ordinator, at 416-415-5000, ext. 3345 (email: mmasoudi@georgebrown.ca). Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges. For more information, call the Contact Centre at 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002. Course exemptions may qualify applicants for course credits, and more information can be found on the Transfer Guide. The Computer Systems Technician program is offered from Monday – Friday: 9 a.m. – 4 p.m.
